fields.headline: Free Shaker Aamer
fields.bodyText: A judicial inquiry into claims that Britain's security services were complicit in torture and rendition of terrorism suspects (Report, 30 June) is welcome. Without an inquiry these shameful revelations will linger on and shame this country's reputation. To be credible the inquiry must be in public and take evidence from former British detainees and especially from Shaker Aamer, the one remaining British detainee still languishing in Guantánamo, after eight years without charge or trial. The Bush administration conceded in 2007 that it had no evidence against him. Shaker Aamer is in extremely bad health due to the harsh conditions and the particularly vicious torture he has experienced. As the longest remaining British detainee in Guantánamo his evidence could be vital to this inquiry. He should be returned to Britain urgently and reunited with his British wife and their four children. Alan Gerrard Woodthorpe, North Yorkshire
